intro: Linosyris triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered linosyris, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters of three, which bloom in early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Linosyris triflora is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in coastal environments.
